articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in F# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in F# (Shape: C)

## Brief Overview
The 13th chord is a popular and colorful chord in music. In this particular case, we are looking at the 13th chord in the key of F# with a C shape. This chord adds a rich and jazzy sound to your playing, often used to add depth and complexity to music.

## Notes and Intervals
The 13th chord in the key of F# with a C shape consists of the following notes:
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (Major 7th)
- G# (Major 9th)
- B# (Major 11th)
- D# (Major 13th)

The chord formula for a 13th chord is typically Root, Major 3rd, Perfect 5th, Major 7th, Major 9th, Major 11th, and Major 13th.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in F# with a C shape is often used in jazz, funk, and R&B music. It adds a sophisticated and complex flavor to the music, creating a lush and harmonically rich sound. Musicians frequently use this chord to create a sense of tension and release, as well as to add colorful extensions to their chord progressions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the 13th chord in F# with a C shape:
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This classic jazz tune features 13th chords throughout, adding to the cool and laid-back vibe of the song.
2. **"I Wish" by Stevie Wonder**: Stevie Wonder incorporates 13th chords in this funky and upbeat track, showcasing the chord's versatility in R&B music.
3. **"Chameleon" by Herbie Hancock**: This jazz-funk anthem prominently features 13th chords, emphasizing the chord's ability to create a groovy and funky atmosphere.

These songs demonstrate the versatility and musical richness that the 13th chord in F# with a C shape can bring to a piece of music.
